original_title: Sri Lanka CB to inject 2026 money in outright auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s central bank has announced outright auctions to purchase bonds with maturities of by injecting cash up to 2026, market participants said.
The central bank has offered to buy 01.08.2026 bonds, and 15.05.2026 bonds up 10 billion rupees.

The planned injections have come as the central bank is under an International Monetary Fund requirement to sell down its Treasury bill stock and effectively run balance of payments surpluses to collect foreign reserves.

Sri Lanka has used techniques including ‘operation twist’ style actions to inject liquidity to overtrading banks, replacing their Treasuries holdings with new money that hits the currency while selling bills to prudent banks to mis-target the government securities yields in the two currency crises in the run up to sovereign default, critics have warned earlier.
Related : Sri Lanka’s central bank buys bonds in new money printing phase

Sri Lanka’s private credit is still weak, though recovering. In December, there is a cash drawdown from the banking system, which is usually accommodated through dollar purchases and short term injections.

The central bank has been injecting overnight money, after selling down bills in volumes bigger than the liquidity created through dollar purchases in the recent past, also providing money to overtrading market participants, though the transactions have not always been inflationary on a net basis. (Colombo/Dec18/2023)
